title: High temperature piezoelectric materials
abstractText: The proposed project concerns the development of piezoelectric materials for use in actuators at high temperatures (200C
findingsText:
The project has compared the ageing and fatigue of high temperature BiFeO3-based piezoelectric ceramics with those of commercial PZT materials. A new testing rig was designed and built as part of the project to allow electrical and mechanical fatigue of piezoelectric ceramics up to temperatures of 200C. Fatigue was carried out both by stress cycling and voltage cycling on single layer and multilayer samples. The BiFeO3 samples were shown to be more resistant to aging and fatigue than both "hard The work was undertaken to demonstrate to the co-sponsor of the work, Rolls Royce Engine Controls Ltd, that the higher temperature BiFeO3 based piezoelectric ceramics could withstand large numbers of operational cycles at elevated temperatures. This knowledge will be used in the design of piezoelectric components for use in future generations of Rolls Royce gas turbine for commercial aviation.
